record.title: REGARDING THE 60TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE FOUNDING OF THE MODERN STATE OF ISRAEL
record.narrative:
REGARDING THE 60TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE FOUNDING OF THE MODERN STATE OF ISRAEL -- (Senate - April 24, 2008)

[Page: S3412]

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of H. Con. Res. 322.

record.chair: The clerk will report the concurrent resolution by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

A concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 322) recognizing the 60th anniversary of the founding of the modern State of Israel and reaffirming the bonds of close friendship and cooperation between the United States and Israel.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the concurrent resolution.

speaking.paragraph: I ask unanimous consent that the concurrent resolution be agreed to, the preamble be agreed to, the motions to reconsider be laid on the table with no intervening action or debate, and any statements relating to this matter be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The concurrent resolution (H. Con. Res. 322) was agreed to.

speaking.paragraph: I would note that Senator Levin has agreed to lead the Senate delegation to this most important occasion. We appreciate very much his doing so. He is one of the senior Members of the Senate and chairman of the Armed Services Committee, an appropriate person to do this.
